t: O*pn God, the nations have come into your inheritance; they*ld have defiled your holy temple; they*ld have laid Jerusalem in ruins.
They*ln have given the bodies of your servants to*ld the birds of the heavens for food, the*ld flesh of your faithful to the beasts of the earth.
They*ln have poured out their blood like water all*ld around Jerusalem, and*ld there was no one to bury them.
We*ln have become a taunt to our neighbors, mocked*ld and derided by those around us.
How*pn long, O Lord?*s Will you be angry forever? Will*ld your jealousy burn like fire?
Pour*ln out your anger on the nations that*ld do not know you, and*ln on the kingdoms that*ld do not call upon your name!
For*ln they have devoured Jacob and*ld laid waste his habitation.
Do*pn not remember against us our former iniquities; let*ld your compassion come speedily to meet us, for*ld we are brought very low.
Help*ln us, O God of our salvation, for*ld the glory of your name; deliver*ln us, and atone for our sins, for*ld your name’s sake!
Why*ln should the nations say, “Where*ld is their God?” Let*ln the avenging of the outpoured blood of your servants be*ld known among the nations before our eyes!
Let*pn the groans of the prisoners come before you; according*ld to your great power, preserve those doomed to die!
Return*ln sevenfold into the lap of our neighbors the*ld taunts with which they have taunted you, O Lord!
But*ln we your people, the sheep of your pasture, will*ld give thanks to you forever; from*ld generation to generation we will recount your praise.
